001package com.technototes.library.command;
002
003import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
004import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
005
006/**
007 * Simple class for commands that require a certain condition to be true to run
008 * <p>
009 * This encapsulates *two* different capabilities.
010 * 1. A ConditionalCommand with only a condition, but no commands, is a a "wait" command.
011 * It will only finish once the condition is true.
012 * 2. A ConditionalCommand with a condition and a true (and optionally false) command
013 * is a generic "if/else" command: If the condition is true, execute the 'true command',
014 * if not true, execute the 'false command' if it is supplied.
015 * <p>
016 * TODO: This makes the class a little clunky. It wouldn't be terrible to break the functionality
017 * TODO: out into multiple classes instead
018 *
019 * @author Alex Stedman
020 */
021public class ConditionalCommand implements Command {
022
023    private BooleanSupplier supplier;
024
025    @Nullable
026    private Command trueCommand, falseCommand;
027
028    /**
029     * This makes a "wait" command
030     *
031     * @param condition The BooleanSupplier that will be waited upon until true
032     */
033    public ConditionalCommand(BooleanSupplier condition) {
034        supplier = condition;
035        trueCommand = null;
036        falseCommand = null;
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * Make a conditional command
041     *
042     * @param condition The condition
043     * @param command   The command to run when the condition is true.
044     */
045    public ConditionalCommand(BooleanSupplier condition, Command command) {
046        supplier = condition;
047        trueCommand = command;
048        CommandScheduler.getInstance().scheduleWithOther(this, trueCommand, condition);
049        falseCommand = null;
050    }
051
052    /**
053     * Make a conditional command
054     *
055     * @param condition The condition
056     * @param trueC     The command to run when the condition is true
057     * @param falseC    The command to run when the condition is false
058     */
059    public ConditionalCommand(BooleanSupplier condition, Command trueC, Command falseC) {
060        supplier = condition;
061        trueCommand = trueC;
062        falseCommand = falseC;
063        CommandScheduler.getInstance().scheduleWithOther(this, trueCommand, condition);
064        CommandScheduler
065            .getInstance()
066            .scheduleWithOther(this, falseCommand, () -> !condition.getAsBoolean());
067    }
068
069    @Override
070    public void execute() {}
071
072    @Override
073    public boolean isFinished() {
074        if (trueCommand == null) return supplier.getAsBoolean();
075        if (falseCommand == null) return trueCommand.justFinished();
076        return trueCommand.justFinished() || falseCommand.justFinished();
077    }
078}
